archimate:Assessment.name: Aki favors a 'Getting Things Done' approach rather than excessive planning
archimate:Assessment.documentation:
Rationale: there's a tendency in the company to create a plan to plan. Aki want to focus on GTD, plans are good, but we shouldn't get stuck in planning. Aki understand the need of long term plans, but really likes to GTD and see progress.
Getting Things Done embodies a pragmatic and results-oriented approach that values actionable progress over exhaustive planning. Aki wants to combat the paralysis that can accompany over-planning, ensuring that people not only sets goals, but also actively works towards achieving them.
It's a widely recognized term, popularized by David Allen's time management method.
